content.description: Same start as Pincer Perfect but move up and left to the high first bolt from the left facing corner. Maybe stick clip it. Cruise up past 4 more bolts to the left facing flake and end the climb where it is convenient to set an anchor. This may be the best protected climb on the formation but the most difficult.
content.protection: 5 bolts. Carry a light rack for the flake and anchor.
content.location: Start in the left facing corner that is slightly left of the obvious flake (Pincer Perfect). Look for the bolt line that slants up and left.

content.description: A really good mixed route starting with awkward moves to gain the obvious flake which ends at the horizontal. Climb directly above passing 4 bolts on the nice exposed face. Move left at the top and construct a gear anchor. The must-do climb on the formation.
content.protection: Moderate rack for the flake and anchor, quickdraws for the bolts.
content.location: Begin this climb down and to the left of the  obvious flake, which doesn't extend  to the ground.

climbs.name: Introspection
climbs.fa: Darrow Kirkpatrick, Jim Brown, Todd Keller, 1981

content.description: The first bolted route at Old Rag and done on homemade aluminum hangers no less. This route still stands as heady sandbagged test piece. It was originally done in two pitches with the first pitch ending in the horizontal crack below the third bolt. Start in the shallow right facing corner approximately 10ft right of the start of Pincer Perfect, down and left of the first bolt. The shallow corner has a deceivingly hard mantle to get above but once you’re past it there is some gear in a small left slanting crack. Be extremely careful as it is probably a ground fall if you come off here.  Continue to move up and right through the first two bolts on good crystals. Once you’ve made it past the second bolt, keep it together on the insecure slab as you inch higher and higher towards the right leaning dike. Above the dike, it’s possible to get gear in the horizontal to protect the moves through the bulge to clip the third bolt. Easier terrain up and right from here will take you to the shared bolt anchor on Pincher Perfect.
content.location: Just to the right of Pincer Perfect, this route starts on the short and shallow right facing corner down and left of the first bolt.

content.description: A mixed climb on the far left end starting off a small detached block. Move up and right past a bolt to an overlap where you need to place good gear. Move a little to the right then up past 2 more bolts and drift onto a left facing flake which will deposit you on the easy slab above.
content.protection: Light rack, small tcu or tcus for the overlap. Set a gear anchor at the top, where convenient. 3 bolts.
content.location: Furthest route on the left. Starts off a small detached block. Look for the bolts. Leave your anchor set until you're ready to leave the area. Most of the climbs end at the same place and it is best to climb out.

content.description: Classic Old Rag slab, which also means you should choose your route carefully: several climbs are run out or offer thin gear placements. Some routes require two ropes to rap.
